**Summary**
• President Trump suggested renaming the Department of Defense to the Department of War.
• The proposal is framed as a countermeasure against the "woke" branding of the Department of Defense.
• The article analyzes the implications and reactions to this potential rebranding.

**Why it matters**
• For observers, the name change reflects a symbolic shift in the perception and presentation of military activities.
• For historians, the name change evokes the Department of War, which was renamed the Department of Defense in 1949.

**Risks**
• The rebrand may be perceived negatively, suggesting a more aggressive or interventionist foreign policy stance.

**Opportunities**
• The proposal sparks public discourse on the role and image of the military.

**Market view**
Market — No direct market impact.
